GIC Client (this software) and the GIC Server are open source products and combined are used to act as a remote control style device for your PC. Copyright 2019 Terence Doerksen
To use this you need to run GIC Server (also Open Source) on your Windows computer where the game resides. Please visit the link below for further information

Thank you for installing GIC - the open source Game Interface Client. Ahead are just a few tips to help you get started. This will only be shown once - tap on the bottom right corner arrow to begin.

GIC requires software on the computer your communicating with. The link is in inside the "About" view from the main screen. Alternatively clicking this button will open your email app with the link to the server inside.

GIC allows you to create fully customizable interfaces (screens) to send commands to an app on your computer. Useful for complex sim type games, but GIC can be used for any app or game that you like. You can also share your screens with others!
I\'ve added Help sections to each part of this app - click the \'?\' at the top right corner of the app for help! Thank you for using GIC!
If you like you can pick one (or more!) of the screens I\'ve built below as a starting point, or you can skip this step and build your own.!
Tapping this icon will explain whats on your devices screen and is available through most of the application
Type the IP Address of the computer running the server. This can be found in Windows 10 by going into Settings, then Network and Internet, and usually starts with \"192\"

After typing in a new name, tap this to Save your changes
Tap here to Customzie your Screen!
This will export your screen and allow you to share with others. The exported file is called \'GIC-(name of screen).ZIP\' and is saved on your device inside the Downloads folder
Tap this to delete the current screen - this cannot be undone!!!

Add Control
To add a button, text, image, etc double tap on the screen roughly where you want the control to go. A list will appear, tap on the type of control you want to add!

Control Options
Tap on the control to select it, and once selected tap to open its Options view. Each Options view has a Help button you can tap for further details.

Edit Mode
Allows you to choose between Drag and drop mode to place the control where you want, vs Detail Edit mode where you can resize the control.

Drag and Drop
In Drag and Drop mode, hold your finger down on a control and drag it to where you want to place it. You can adjust (or disable) the snap-to-grid feature in Settings (see below)

Adjust Size
When in Detail mode, tap on a control to display 3 scrollbars. The vertical one on the left will let you adjust the height. The top horizontal will allow you to adjust the width. The bottom (if applicable) will let you adjust the text size for buttons and switches.

Settings
Here you can choose an image for the background of your screen, or pick a color (default is a dark grey) You can also adjust the Snap-to-grid sizing here.

Save
Tapping this will save all your changes!

Text
At the top you can change what text to show, by default its "New"

Font Color
Here you can change the color of the text

Font
A small selection of different fonts, due to limitations of Android if there is a font you want to use, please contact me.

Font Size
Allows you to specify the exact size of the text you want.

Left / Top
Allows you to specify the exact position of the control.

Width / Height
Allows you to specify the display area size of the control.

Save
Saves the above options you chose.

Delete
Deletes the control - this can't be undone!

Text
At the top you can change what text to show, by default its "New"

Select a Key
You can select a keyboard command to send to the computer, and choose to include the Shift, Ctrl, or Alt key on your keyboard. This will be sent when you tap on the button.

Font Color
Here you can change the color of the text

Font
A small selection of different fonts, due to limitations of Android if there is a font you want to use, please contact me.

Font Size
Allows you to specify the exact size of the text you want.

Button Graphics
By default you can pick an image to show when the button normally, and when it\'s pressed down. Turning this off lets you use a color gradient instead.

Quick Mode
By default, a button will stay pressed down as long as you hold it. In some games that use the same button as a quick toggle and press to hold, it may not work as a quick toggle. Enable this to set it to Quick Mode which will send a command quick as soon as you press it, regardless of how long you hold it down.

Normal
When in Button Graphics mode, tap this to choose an image for the button when it\'s not being pressed down. There are several built in graphics, and you can also Import your own.

Pressed
When in Button Graphics mode, tap this to choose an image for the button when it\'s not being pressed down. There are several built in graphics, and you can also Import your own.

Primary Color
When Button Graphics mode is turned off, tap this to choose the primary button color. When pressed the colors are inverted.

Secondary Color
When Button Graphics mode is turned off, tap this to choose the secondary button color. When pressed the colors are inverted.

Left / Top
Allows you to specify the exact position of the control.

Width / Height
Allows you to specify the display area size of the control.

Save
Saves the above options you chose.

Delete
Deletes the control - this can't be undone!

Text
At the top you can change what text to show, by default its "New"

Toggle on Command
You can select a keyboard command to send to the computer when you turn the switch "on", and you can include the Shift, Ctrl, or Alt key on your keyboard. This will be sent when you tap on the button when it\'s currently set to "Off".

Toggle off Command
You can select a keyboard command to send to the computer when you turn the switch "off", and you can include the Shift, Ctrl, or Alt key on your keyboard. This will be sent when you tap on the button when it\'s currently set to "On".

Font Color
Here you can change the color of the text

Font
A small selection of different fonts, due to limitations of Android if there is a font you want to use, please contact me.

Font Size
Allows you to specify the exact size of the text you want.

Off
Tap this to choose an image for the Off position of the switch. There are several built in graphics, and you can also Import your own.

On
Tap this to choose an image for the On position of the switch. There are several built in graphics, and you can also Import your own.

Left / Top
Allows you to specify the exact position of the control.

Width / Height
Allows you to specify the display area size of the control.

Save
Saves the above options you chose.

Delete
Deletes the control - this can't be undone!

Image
This will let you choose an image you have stored on your device to display.

Left / Top
Allows you to specify the exact position of the control.

Width / Height
Allows you to specify the display area size of the control.

Save
Saves the above options you chose.

Delete
Deletes the control - this can't be undone!
